intro: Matricaria elongata, commonly known as German chamomile, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its daisy-like yellow flower heads surrounded by white, fuzzy petals. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in well-drained soil in full sun. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, often used in herbal teas. The essential oil extracted from its flowers contains compounds like chamazulene, which contribute to its calming properties.
